The West Palm Beach, FL, City Clerk is "hereby created, as a division within the office of the Mayor. (WPB Code, Sec. 2-134) The Mayor "shall appoint and remove all department directors (including City Clerk) without consent and approval of the City Commission..."(Sec. 3.04)

answers.author: Robert Kiely
answers.text:
In Lake Forest, IL the Charter has the City Clerk appointed by the Mayor and City Council. In practice, the City Council appoints the City Manager as City Clerk and the City Manager hires a deputy clerk to handle most of the day to day functions.

author: [Anonymous]
text:
I'm just curious about what is the most common employment arrangement for a city clerk:
-Elected position like a Mayor or Councilmember
-Appointed by the governing body like the City Manager, City Attorney, and Municipal Judge may be
-Hired as a staff member and reporting to the City Manager like any other employee
title: City Clerk: Elected, Appointed, or Hired Staff?
